intro: Adenia bequaertii subsp. bequaertii, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a climbing shrub native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Passifloraceae and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces bright red berries that are edible for birds and mammals. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its unique nocturnal blooming habit makes it a fascinating subject for botanical study.
